page.title: 15SETTLEMENTS
page.content: The only clusters of{settlement in the area are the 2 small{hamlets}of Frogwell and Newbridge, a mere 700m apart by road. {Frogwell}is sited on a SW facing valley side, and contains 13 old buildings. Renovation work on{Frogwell {Farm}showed early building methods _ 2 foot thick cob{walls}made of earth, stone and horse hair, and old wooden beams (complete with bark) as the main {roof}supports. The hamlet has long been a{Methodist centre}and the present chapel is dated 1864. {Newbridge}is at the bridging point of the Lynher and was once a busy rural centre catering for the needs of local farmers. In 1914 there was a{corn mill, saw mill, carpenters {shop, smithy}and{an Inn}in the hamlet. Now the converted buildings contribute to the 8 homes in the hamlet.
